thread.title_full: Police issue alert after man exposes himself to child in Morton Grove - Park Ridge Herald-Advocate

author: Natalie Hayes
title: Police issue alert after man exposes himself to child in Morton Grove - Park Ridge Herald-Advocate
text:
Morton Grove police Thursday, Oct. 8 issued an alert to all schools in Niles and Morton Grove after a man exposed himself to an 11-year-old boy on Wednesday.
According to Commander Paul Yaras, of the Morton Grove Police Department, the child was walking alone on Oleander Avenue and Suffield Street at 4:30 p.m. when a man driving a dark-colored vehicle pulled over and exposed his genitals.
The man lured the boy toward his car by asking him if he lost $20 on the street, and when the child approached he noticed the man was undressed from the waist down.
The man lifted up his shirt to expose his genitals and drove away, police said.
The offender was described by a witness as approximately 40-years-old with balding hair and a medium build. His vehicle was possibly a dark gray Buick Enclave with Illinois license plates, police said.
Morton Grove police issued an alert to all school districts in Morton Grove and Niles, but did not say which school the boy attends. Melzer and Nelson Schools are closest to the location of the incident, according to Yaras.
"We want parents to talk to their kids about what to do if a stranger approaches," Yaras said. "It can happen real quick—in this case the man drove away, but anything could have happened."
Police on Thursday were interviewing two adult witnesses who may have seen the vehicle.
Natalie Hayes is a freelance reporter for Pioneer Press.
